subject: Fix tests for package/bundle import
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-27 13:54:25.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/functional/sanity_check.py'], 'message': 'Fix tests for package/bundle import

Two following tests where generating invalid package manifest and
than trying to import generated package:
* test_import_bundle_from_repo
* test_import_package_from_repo

This tests are passing but when we will add package validation on import
using openstack/murano-pkg-check they will start failing.

This commit also removes non-working validation of the versioned import
from the catalog which needs to be fixed at some point of time:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/murano/+bug/1637211

Change-Id: Iae6b56b2f7d32c75515ee92f0e33f9e3af9924e9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tests for package/bundle import

Two following tests where generating invalid package manifest and
than trying to import generated package:
* test_import_bundle_from_repo
* test_import_package_from_repo

This tests are passing but when we will add package validation on import
using openstack/murano-pkg-check they will start failing.

This commit also removes non-working validation of the versioned import
from the catalog which needs to be fixed at some point of time:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/murano/+bug/1637211

Change-Id: Iae6b56b2f7d32c75515ee92f0e33f9e3af9924e9

commit_message:
Refactoring Monasca role to align more with OSA.

 - This patch is to provide monasca backend services and monasca api,log-api
 - Adding the use of dictionary for service group mappings.
 - Switching to use tested external roles for backend services.

Change-Id: I7f6335f12a4b3a13acf6b644f16587ab1b46745f

subject: Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-02 13:07:45.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/designate_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: I5e97ed325ba7971a1b483ac1278d0450026bdf18
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: I5e97ed325ba7971a1b483ac1278d0450026bdf18

When a subproject wants to create a class to extend the Neutron API,
that class inherits from ExtensionDescriptor.  This change pulls
ExtensionDescriptor over to neutron-lib so that subprojects can inherit
from it.  This class is almost entirely abstract.

This is used by nearly every neutron stadium project.

Change-Id: I4e9ba9c0c7fd4c5f449f11b4f401fa265ae7ea43
'}]
commit_message:
Add ExtensionDescriptor to neutron-lib

When a subproject wants to create a class to extend the Neutron API,
that class inherits from ExtensionDescriptor.  This change pulls
ExtensionDescriptor over to neutron-lib so that subprojects can inherit
from it.  This class is almost entirely abstract.

This is used by nearly every neutron stadium project.

Change-Id: I4e9ba9c0c7fd4c5f449f11b4f401fa265ae7ea43

subject: Revert "drop non-I/O threading in upgrade"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-01 16:17:22.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py'], 'message': 'Revert "drop non-I/O threading in upgrade"

This reverts commit 84443ca4d47cbee9efa0e1ad1df63ff2ae7f8b1f.

commit_message:
Revert "drop non-I/O threading in upgrade"

This reverts commit 84443ca4d47cbee9efa0e1ad1df63ff2ae7f8b1f.

Upgrade with some storage drivers such as Swift consumes a lot of I/O with high
latency, so running in parallel improve speed.

Change-Id: I65106a5fbb8cd19235274ea55fb19fe2ecff9093

Change-Id: If80d91351c05dd26fe97133ff43303fa7ea2fe06
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: If80d91351c05dd26fe97133ff43303fa7ea2fe06

commit_message:
Disable SMT for ppc64 hypervisor and set VNC

On ppc64le KVM hypervisor SMT is enabled by default.
Adding the task to disable SMT to allow launching the instance in
running state.

Setting the default console type as noVNC for ppc64 arch.

Change-Id: I119455a499255725dd616eb488a1c67f828d925a

subject: rationalize trove CI jobs for stable branches
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-02 15:41:22.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "rationalize trove CI jobs for stable branches

As part of the project to get rid of the trove-integration repository,
all things there were moved into the trove repository early in
Ocata. Therefore, for stable liberty/mitaka and newton, CI will
continue to use trove-integration, and for master (soon to be Ocata),
and beyond we don't use trove-integration.

In refactoring the CI jobs, I failed to handle the stable branches
properly and for two jobs in particular, gate-trove-functional-dsvm-
and gate-trove-scenario-functional-dsvm-, I did not ensure that stable
branches got the right jobs. This commit aims to fix that.

I hope :)

Here is the detailed list of changes being made.

1. in jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml, many of the trove-integration jobs
were mixed in with the trove jobs in the trove project. Made a
trove-integration project and moved the trove-integration specific
jobs there.

2. in jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml the trove job
gate-trove-legacy-functional-dsvm- is now independent of the
trove-integration job by the same name.

3. in zuul/layout.yaml added branch specifiers for the
gate-trove-legacy- and gate-trove- non-legacy jobs.

4. in zuul/layout.yaml, add gate-trove-legacy-scenario-functional-
jobs to trove.

Change-Id: I8bfdc22b814799b2aaaa7ecd077bb2e5a9b989e4
"}]
commit_message:
rationalize trove CI jobs for stable branches

As part of the project to get rid of the trove-integration repository,
all things there were moved into the trove repository early in
Ocata. Therefore, for stable liberty/mitaka and newton, CI will
continue to use trove-integration, and for master (soon to be Ocata),
and beyond we don't use trove-integration.

In refactoring the CI jobs, I failed to handle the stable branches
properly and for two jobs in particular, gate-trove-functional-dsvm-
and gate-trove-scenario-functional-dsvm-, I did not ensure that stable
branches got the right jobs. This commit aims to fix that.

I hope :)

Here is the detailed list of changes being made.

1. in jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml, many of the trove-integration jobs
were mixed in with the trove jobs in the trove project. Made a
trove-integration project and moved the trove-integration specific
jobs there.

2. in jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml the trove job
gate-trove-legacy-functional-dsvm- is now independent of the
trove-integration job by the same name.

3. in zuul/layout.yaml added branch specifiers for the
gate-trove-legacy- and gate-trove- non-legacy jobs.

4. in zuul/layout.yaml, add gate-trove-legacy-scenario-functional-
jobs to trove.

Change-Id: I8bfdc22b814799b2aaaa7ecd077bb2e5a9b989e4

When send os-security-groups api to nova. It will display empty table.

Because nova will send request to neutron to get security group
rules. And neutron had one special secgroup rule which protocol is

commit_message:
nova secgroup-list-rules shows empty table with neutron

When send os-security-groups api to nova. It will display empty table.

Because nova will send request to neutron to get security group
rules. And neutron had one special secgroup rule which protocol is
null. Then nova will just show them.

Maybe we can just filter those rules which protocol is null.

Change-Id: I9363be49133ac372f9bd39c72f3c44d4bf8ead31
Closes-Bug: 1463372

Previously _cleanup_resize would recreate the instance resize directory
after first removing it. This behaviour was introduced in I328d2c416
where the imagebackend is used to check that a root disk exists before
attempting to remove any resize snapshots.

The call to remove this directory is now moved below these imagebackend
checks ensuring that the directory is not recreated.

Finally the contents of the _cleanup_resize method is also moved up into
its only caller confirm_migration.

Change-Id: I95d9e7ded7f02061cea12420cfefc9872f6175d1
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Ensure the instance resize directory is removed

Previously _cleanup_resize would recreate the instance resize directory
after first removing it. This behaviour was introduced in I328d2c416
where the imagebackend is used to check that a root disk exists before
attempting to remove any resize snapshots.

The call to remove this directory is now moved below these imagebackend
checks ensuring that the directory is not recreated.

Finally the contents of the _cleanup_resize method is also moved up into
its only caller confirm_migration.

Closes-Bug: #1592015
Change-Id: I95d9e7ded7f02061cea12420cfefc9872f6175d1

commit_message:
Use IPOpt and PortOpt in vnc options

IPOpt/PortOpt have been added to oslo.config to provide higher level
validation than StrOpt/IntOpt.

Change-Id: I030bb2f2c1167a14f62d97efa6cf592cd9a32778

subject: Removed unnecessary sleep from devstack plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-31 13:20:19.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Removed unnecessary sleep from devstack plugin

The step installing influxdb sleeps for a full minute before allowing
the plugin to progress.  The commented explanation is to wait for
influxdb to start, elect a leader and begin accepting connections.
However, the subsequent part of the process is to install various
packages (via apt and git) then build the java or python monasca-api
code.  The chances of that being done before a minute is out are low.
The sleep is therefore redundant and aggravating.

Change-Id: I985bede38890a0ab0abafc93bda0feaafe2fa99b
'}]
commit_message:
Removed unnecessary sleep from devstack plugin

The step installing influxdb sleeps for a full minute before allowing
the plugin to progress.  The commented explanation is to wait for
influxdb to start, elect a leader and begin accepting connections.
However, the subsequent part of the process is to install various
packages (via apt and git) then build the java or python monasca-api
code.  The chances of that being done before a minute is out are low.
The sleep is therefore redundant and aggravating.

Change-Id: I985bede38890a0ab0abafc93bda0feaafe2fa99b

    libvirt/live_migration_permit_auto_converge

commit_message:
libvirt: Set mutable for post copy and auto converge opts

Make these options mutable:

    libvirt/live_migration_permit_post_copy
    libvirt/live_migration_permit_auto_converge

These are used to initialise the live_migration_flags and
block_migration_flags during init_host on startup, so I've added a
mutate hook to init_host. This will reinitialise those flags when a
mutate is triggered.

bp mutable-config-ocata

Change-Id: I76453a1337cb81263f9a1f21e4b6cab4ac8d6864

subject: DRAC get_bios_config() passthru causes exception
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 17998, 'name': 'UFCG OneView CI', 'email': 'ufcg-oneview-ci@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'ufcg-oneview-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 18893, 'name': 'Miles Gould', 'email': 'mgould@redhat.com', 'username': 'pozorvlak'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 11:07:09.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/drac/vendor_passthru.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/drac/test_bios.py', 'releasenotes/notes/drac-fix-get_bios_config-vendor-passthru-causes-exception-1e1dbeeb3e924f29.yaml'], 'message': "DRAC get_bios_config() passthru causes exception

The DRAC driver's (pxe_drac) get_bios_config() vendor passthru method
raises an AttributeError exception. It no longer returns the current
BIOS configuration. This is a regression from stable/mitaka.

Triage found that get_bios_config() mistakenly treats the value returned
by python-dracclient's list_bios_settings() as containing named tuples.
When it calls the namedtuple _asdict() method, an AttributeError
exception is raised.

Revert get_bios_config()'s handling of the return value to use __dict__.
Remove the comment that is not consistent with the implementation.

Also revert the unit test case for a successful call to use mock to
create the return value. Use mock.NonCallableMock with an empty
specification (spec) to catch this type of bug in the future.

Change-Id: I94afaa72a1ef25efc1b622e29e3a92a5d27f1892
Closes-Bug: #1637671
(cherry picked from commit 6d6cf18f3171f42af1567c65240a7a6a759377c2)
"}]
commit_message:
DRAC get_bios_config() passthru causes exception

The DRAC driver's (pxe_drac) get_bios_config() vendor passthru method
raises an AttributeError exception. It no longer returns the current
BIOS configuration. This is a regression from stable/mitaka.

Triage found that get_bios_config() mistakenly treats the value returned
by python-dracclient's list_bios_settings() as containing named tuples.
When it calls the namedtuple _asdict() method, an AttributeError
exception is raised.

Revert get_bios_config()'s handling of the return value to use __dict__.
Remove the comment that is not consistent with the implementation.

Also revert the unit test case for a successful call to use mock to
create the return value. Use mock.NonCallableMock with an empty
specification (spec) to catch this type of bug in the future.

Change-Id: I94afaa72a1ef25efc1b622e29e3a92a5d27f1892
Closes-Bug: #1637671
(cherry picked from commit 6d6cf18f3171f42af1567c65240a7a6a759377c2)

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: I4ae42c242d618c10828f998722f021ca1b9410eb

subject: Use InstanceId as unique attribute identifier rather than name
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-10-27 19:38:37.000000000', 'files': ['dracclient/client.py', 'dracclient/tests/test_bios.py', 'dracclient/resources/bios.py'], 'message': 'Use InstanceId as unique attribute identifier rather than name

AttributeName just happens to be unique for everything under
DCIM_BIOS* but this is not a guarantee. Using InstanceId instead
which is guaranteed to be unique.

Discussion on the list
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-September/103602.html

Closes-Bug: #1635419
Signed-off-by: Anish Bhatt <anish.bhatt@salesforce.com>
Change-Id: I93c0f7919ecfd77642634d1d0addfe8a79aa6f57
'}]
commit_message:
Use InstanceId as unique attribute identifier rather than name

AttributeName just happens to be unique for everything under
DCIM_BIOS* but this is not a guarantee. Using InstanceId instead
which is guaranteed to be unique.

Discussion on the list
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-September/103602.html

Closes-Bug: #1635419
Signed-off-by: Anish Bhatt <anish.bhatt@salesforce.com>
Change-Id: I93c0f7919ecfd77642634d1d0addfe8a79aa6f57

subject: DevStack: use Felix 1.4 plus floating IP fix
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 16:05:03.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings'], 'message': "DevStack: use Felix 1.4 plus floating IP fix

(We are in the process of releasing a new version of Felix, that is
written partly in Python and partly in Go, but haven't yet worked out
the detail of how Calico DevStack will use that.  So for now - so that
networking-calico CI can continue working - point to a branch that is
the last 1.4 Felix release (1.4.4), plus a fix to allow floating IPs to
be available from an instance's compute host.)

Change-Id: I15208b7f4662e79ba625e8d8bcbc9e1398b30fde
"}]
commit_message:
DevStack: use Felix 1.4 plus floating IP fix

(We are in the process of releasing a new version of Felix, that is
written partly in Python and partly in Go, but haven't yet worked out
the detail of how Calico DevStack will use that.  So for now - so that
networking-calico CI can continue working - point to a branch that is
the last 1.4 Felix release (1.4.4), plus a fix to allow floating IPs to
be available from an instance's compute host.)

subject: Ensure upper constraints are respected
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-02 13:39:16.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_client_install.yml'], 'message': 'Ensure upper constraints are respected

With the current python package installation, packages
are installed with no regard to upper constraints. This
can result in an inconsistent set of packages being
installed when re-executing the role.

This patch ensures that if upper constraints are defined
then they are respected.

Change-Id: Id1e7e8f74f513c022e7f06942c65da94ad7df9d8
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure upper constraints are respected

With the current python package installation, packages
are installed with no regard to upper constraints. This
can result in an inconsistent set of packages being
installed when re-executing the role.

This patch ensures that if upper constraints are defined
then they are respected.

Change-Id: Id1e7e8f74f513c022e7f06942c65da94ad7df9d8

commit_message:
Use proper murano package backend in openrc

Use only 'glare' as package backend, because 'glance' is deprecated.
Also leave backward compatibility with 'glance' on removing it from
openrc file in case of changing package backend.

Change-Id: I9182d62897d3f214d7d2b45e22de2d97031e0984
Closes-bug: #1638296

revisions:

Neutron has a non dvr, ha mode which can be a default (by
 l3_ha = True) option for all router creation.

test_centralized_router_update_to_dvr admin test case

Change-Id: Ib262f32133aae50cdb01d2489830499fb5c30f44
'}]
commit_message:
Make the non ha router usage explicit in a dvr test

Neutron has a non dvr, ha mode which can be a default (by
 l3_ha = True) option for all router creation.

test_centralized_router_update_to_dvr admin test case
needs to define an additional option in order to
get a `legacy` non ha router in the initial step.

Change-Id: Ib262f32133aae50cdb01d2489830499fb5c30f44

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-24 18:09:25.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder'], 'message': 'Setup the Cinder image-volume cache by default

This will have devstack setup the Cinder internal tenant and generic
image-volume cache by default. If left alone it will use reasonable
defaults.

More information about configuration options and the cache can be found
here: http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/blockstorage_image_volume_cache.html

As part of this we switch the default lvm type to thin so it will
work more efficiently with the image cache.

Change-Id: I0b2cc261736f32d38d43c60254f0dc7225b24c01
Implements: blueprint cinder-image-volume-cache'}]
commit_message:
Setup the Cinder image-volume cache by default

This will have devstack setup the Cinder internal tenant and generic
image-volume cache by default. If left alone it will use reasonable
defaults.

More information about configuration options and the cache can be found
here: http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/blockstorage_image_volume_cache.html

As part of this we switch the default lvm type to thin so it will
work more efficiently with the image cache.

Change-Id: I0b2cc261736f32d38d43c60254f0dc7225b24c01
Implements: blueprint cinder-image-volume-cache

subject: Make unstack.sh more independently deterministic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 09:18:10.000000000', 'files': ['unstack.sh'], 'message': "Make unstack.sh more independently deterministic

In some initialization conditions (having never ran stack.sh) the
result of unstack.sh is dependent on if the user had previously
installed lvm2 or disabled the cinder service.

This change makes all results the same with a bit of LBYL.

There's also a drive-by to put a comment back where it belongs after
being accidentally moved in the related change.

Related-Change: I09b1a7bee0785e5e1bb7dc96158a654bd3f15c83

Change-Id: I9a7e052677d60cbbbdd582877f3c6c48c387f668
Closes-Bug: #1619195
"}]
commit_message:
Make unstack.sh more independently deterministic

In some initialization conditions (having never ran stack.sh) the
result of unstack.sh is dependent on if the user had previously
installed lvm2 or disabled the cinder service.

This change makes all results the same with a bit of LBYL.

There's also a drive-by to put a comment back where it belongs after
being accidentally moved in the related change.

Related-Change: I09b1a7bee0785e5e1bb7dc96158a654bd3f15c83

Change-Id: I9a7e052677d60cbbbdd582877f3c6c48c387f668
Closes-Bug: #1619195

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-02 12:39:01.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/ipxe_config.template', 'releasenotes/notes/ipxe-dhcp-b799bc326cd2529a.yaml', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/ipxe_config_timeout.template', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/ipxe_uefi_config.template', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ipxe_config.template'], 'message': 'Remove "dhcp" command from the iPXE template

At this point we already have DHCP on the right NIC to be able to download
this iPXE script. The "dhcp" may actually break the boot, as it runs DHCP
on the first available interface, not the PXE booting one.

Change-Id: I97dc897da49ceb8e03476ddacd5bc92dd40aa4b2
Closes-Bug: #1635191
(cherry picked from commit 42b2c60ce2aeb91a9fda213cda87a22f87bb0161)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "dhcp" command from the iPXE template

At this point we already have DHCP on the right NIC to be able to download
this iPXE script. The "dhcp" may actually break the boot, as it runs DHCP
on the first available interface, not the PXE booting one.

Change-Id: I97dc897da49ceb8e03476ddacd5bc92dd40aa4b2
Closes-Bug: #1635191
(cherry picked from commit 42b2c60ce2aeb91a9fda213cda87a22f87bb0161)

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-22 17:43:49.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/common/utils/test_net_utils.py', 'tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/common/utils/net_utils.py'], 'message': "neutron: added test case to check connectivity using MTU sized frames

Properly configured setup must allow frames of network MTU size (as
reported by Neutron net-mtu API extension) through the network.

Sadly, Cirros images ship ping tools that don't support the -M argument
that allows to set Don't Fragment flag, so the only way to enforce it is
from outside the instance.

Related-Bug: #1623876
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: added test case to check connectivity using MTU sized frames

Properly configured setup must allow frames of network MTU size (as
reported by Neutron net-mtu API extension) through the network.

Sadly, Cirros images ship ping tools that don't support the -M argument
that allows to set Don't Fragment flag, so the only way to enforce it is
from outside the instance.

Change-Id: I1dd0633e48dbc9b67cd79e610e959b514304a4b5
Related-Bug: #1623876

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 11:04:56.000000000', 'files': ['etc/api-paste.ini', 'etc/oslo-config-generator/neutron.conf', 'releasenotes/notes/Adds-http_proxy_to_wsgi-middleware-24e8271cbd94ffdf.yaml'], 'message': "Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Neutron-API. The
purpose of this middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Neutron.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Neutron, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ice9ee8f4e04050271d59858f92034c230325718b
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 19c354aacd27f6941467e34826774c6199bc4f8f)
"}]
commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Neutron-API. The
purpose of this middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Neutron.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Neutron, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ice9ee8f4e04050271d59858f92034c230325718b
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 19c354aacd27f6941467e34826774c6199bc4f8f)

commit_message:
Adding Tempest cloning and requirements installation to Dockerfile

It can be useful for 'rally verify'. So we will be able to install Tempest
and run the tests on environments where there is no Internet connection.

$ rally verify install --source /var/lib/tempest --system-wide
$ rally verify genconfig
$ rally verify start --system-wide

Change-Id: If1a9c9c53fe56761d4d84d5599765a4e2535e52a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 08:17:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Don't depend on translated strings for error check

Currently, execute() may raise an exception that contains a *translated*
string that starts with 'Exit code: %(returncode)d...' if the returncode
of a process was not 0. find_child_pids() will then check if the
raised exception contains 'Exit code: 1' (to check if the returncode is
1), but in non-English locales this will fail as the 2 strings are not
encoded the same.

This patch adds a new ProcessExecutionError (which inherits from
RuntimeError, so as to not change all the code that currently depends on
execute() returning RuntimeError) which now accepts a returncode. This
can be changed explicitly without depending on the error message.

Later patches can move ProcessExecutionError to neutron-lib, if this is
needed - this patch intends to write the smallest piece of code that can
be backported.

Closes-Bug: #1638273
Change-Id: I85d3bec13e852918eb13e73c1367c70e1f4d34b1
(cherry picked from commit 3c1bf8697b9be4a406e978af8a3329389f992514)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't depend on translated strings for error check

Currently, execute() may raise an exception that contains a *translated*
string that starts with 'Exit code: %(returncode)d...' if the returncode
of a process was not 0. find_child_pids() will then check if the
raised exception contains 'Exit code: 1' (to check if the returncode is
1), but in non-English locales this will fail as the 2 strings are not
encoded the same.

This patch adds a new ProcessExecutionError (which inherits from
RuntimeError, so as to not change all the code that currently depends on
execute() returning RuntimeError) which now accepts a returncode. This
can be changed explicitly without depending on the error message.

Later patches can move ProcessExecutionError to neutron-lib, if this is
needed - this patch intends to write the smallest piece of code that can
be backported.

Closes-Bug: #1638273
Change-Id: I85d3bec13e852918eb13e73c1367c70e1f4d34b1
(cherry picked from commit 3c1bf8697b9be4a406e978af8a3329389f992514)

commit_message:
use kuryr-lib master code by default in kuryr-libnetwork vagrant

Currently, devstack will install kuryr-lib 0.1.0 for
kuryr-libnetwork. But we still need to check if kuryr-libnetwork
can work with kuryr-lib master code. This patch introduce
LIBS_FROM_GIT to let devstack install latest kuryr-lib code.
And let kuryr-libnetwork use kuryr-lib master code by default
in vagrant.

Change-Id: Id05dab5bd6a4aa2efe5f6991e9fd5fc38c1cf91b
Partially-implements: bp cross-project-ci
Closes-bug: #1630971

commit_message:
Use 'openstack security group delete' to replace 'nova secgroup-delete'

The command 'nova secgroup-delete' is deprecated and will be
removed after Nova 15.0.0 is released, so this patch use
'openstack security group delete' to replace it for cleanup.

Change-Id: I3bb7b2e10f39e75746e9cf1b04b4cb46b4a71d70
Implements: blueprint use-openstack-command

commit_message:
Add network gateway validation

Check whether the gateway defined in `undercloud.conf` exists and is
reachable.

This validation demonstrates how to use the hiera facter to get the
path to undercloud.conf file.

Change-Id: I23f520baf0d787807ba7275c1b2e69a1a671529d

subject: Make the ini-based validations more robust
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 15:53:25.000000000', 'files': ['validations/undercloud-debug.yaml', 'validations/ceilometerdb-size.yaml', 'validations/library/ini.py'], 'message': "Make the ini-based validations more robust

They were failing when some of the config files they were checking
didn't exist even though that shouldn't be a problem in these particular
cases.

So this updates the ini module to handle missing files, ini sections and
values. In addition, the `failed_when` check is simplified.

Change-Id: I6c0fb3ba8b16c7a442f764479b7e3c1703e5939e
Closes-Bug: 1620549
(cherry picked from commit 8502c3ad51787838c120d347266fd29324011aca)
"}]
commit_message:
Make the ini-based validations more robust

They were failing when some of the config files they were checking
didn't exist even though that shouldn't be a problem in these particular
cases.

So this updates the ini module to handle missing files, ini sections and
values. In addition, the `failed_when` check is simplified.

Change-Id: I6c0fb3ba8b16c7a442f764479b7e3c1703e5939e
Closes-Bug: 1620549
(cherry picked from commit 8502c3ad51787838c120d347266fd29324011aca)

commit_message:
Remove `become: true` from the inventory script

Most validations don't need to be run as root and those that do can
opt-in by saying `become: true` per validation or task.

Change-Id: Iade6ba1302af11e9790719ab0fd3193dc671ffba
(cherry picked from commit 9e66114bd95a226576b227505b5b7de6216d6507)

subject: Remove unused statements in matches
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-11-02 16:09:14.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/models/revoke_model.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_revoke.py'], 'message': 'Remove unused statements in matches

With recent changes [1], in list_events in the sql backend there is no
longer a need to use repetitive statements. list_events already prunes
out rows based off user_id, project_id, audit_id and issued_at so we
can remove these subsequent statements in matches.
In order to test this, the _assertToken methods needed to call the
list_events method directly. The old implementation ignores
list_events and instead makes a list where it can "add_event" and
"remove_event" which bypasses testing the actual changes made in
list_events since the tests assume list_events would have just sent
back the entire list anyway rather than what it does now which is
filter events based off the token

[1] 9e84371461831880ce5736e9888c7d9648e3a77b
Change-Id: Ib76a14428f46b8b6669c412764de22faf1ac2e3b
Related-Bug: 1524030
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused statements in matches

With recent changes [1], in list_events in the sql backend there is no
longer a need to use repetitive statements. list_events already prunes
out rows based off user_id, project_id, audit_id and issued_at so we
can remove these subsequent statements in matches.
In order to test this, the _assertToken methods needed to call the
list_events method directly. The old implementation ignores
list_events and instead makes a list where it can "add_event" and
"remove_event" which bypasses testing the actual changes made in
list_events since the tests assume list_events would have just sent
back the entire list anyway rather than what it does now which is
filter events based off the token

[1] 9e84371461831880ce5736e9888c7d9648e3a77b
Change-Id: Ib76a14428f46b8b6669c412764de22faf1ac2e3b
Related-Bug: 1524030

commit_message:
Added pause/resume feature

KeyboardInterrupt now pauses the runner. From there, the user can
Ctrl-C again or type "quit" to stop execution, or press ENTER to continue.

Change-Id: Ib0384bbd06c248ba0f5dd61cfa16c8c3aaea975e

subject: [WIP] Bump ansible version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-01 18:52:04.000000000', 'files': ['test-ansible-deps.txt'], 'message': "[WIP] Bump ansible version

Review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391899 is failing the CentOS
job due to a bug [1] with ansible where it doesn't correctly upgrade
packages with the yum module.  This review simply bumps ansible to
2.2.0, which allows the mentioned CentOS job to complete successfully.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/pull/4547

Change-Id: Ia552b2ae504e6682922714cf87d237feab86f781
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Bump ansible version

Review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391899 is failing the CentOS
job due to a bug [1] with ansible where it doesn't correctly upgrade
packages with the yum module.  This review simply bumps ansible to
2.2.0, which allows the mentioned CentOS job to complete successfully.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/pull/4547

Change-Id: Ia552b2ae504e6682922714cf87d237feab86f781

subject: Virt driver private storage
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-27 19:24:25.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/virt-driver-private-storage.rst'], 'message': 'Virt driver private storage

The libvirt would like to store instance XML during the entire
lifetime of an instance in Nova. In order to do this in a
driver-agnostic way, this spec proposes private storage in the
database for virt drivers to use as they please.

Change-Id: I4477b9d67c5058ba65197d07d5b7e4b441be77aa
'}]
commit_message:
Virt driver private storage

The libvirt would like to store instance XML during the entire
lifetime of an instance in Nova. In order to do this in a
driver-agnostic way, this spec proposes private storage in the
database for virt drivers to use as they please.

Change-Id: I4477b9d67c5058ba65197d07d5b7e4b441be77aa

commit_message:
Add a missing error check in ipmitool driver's reboot

This patch adds a missing error check into ipmitool power driver's
reboot so that the reboot can fail properly if power off failed.

Change-Id: Icd061fe51555be3200b154c5e43e0f082864c93f
Closes-bug: #1633992
(cherry picked from commit c073fb714df0477a625e2e4eee89edfee4a03576)

The last 4.0.0 kombu release causes oslo.messaging unit-tests
to fail due to some incompatible changes (which likely won't
be fixed in future releases).

Change-Id: I7b8d467ef612b1023fb2b680dd222ad75f494525
Closes-Bug: #1638263

commit_message:
Set upper constraint on kombu to be < 4.0.0

The last 4.0.0 kombu release causes oslo.messaging unit-tests
to fail due to some incompatible changes (which likely won't
be fixed in future releases).

Change-Id: I7b8d467ef612b1023fb2b680dd222ad75f494525
Closes-Bug: #1638263

Invalidate parameters (set parameters as not loaded) when
environment configuration changes

commit_message:
Remove duplicate default=None for config options

In oslo.config, all type config options have default value None if
don't set parameter default. So don't need set this config option.

Change-Id: I8fe37e7fa792bd9d452f550d1c1e67e5245b4ada

subject: Wait for a config drive device to be available
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 11:43:32.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_lib/tests/test_disk_utils.py', 'ironic_lib/disk_utils.py'], 'message': 'Wait for a config drive device to be available

A failure may occur if the dd to config drive partition happens
before it actually becomes available. This change adds a udevadm
settle call that ensures that config drive device is present in
/dev folder.

Closes-Bug: #1633063
Change-Id: I5526f791371e7a6f4cdad151bb163707504e76cf
(cherry picked from commit 939c026950756a926056a9ee24a18b02a150bb82)
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for a config drive device to be available

A failure may occur if the dd to config drive partition happens
before it actually becomes available. This change adds a udevadm
settle call that ensures that config drive device is present in
/dev folder.

Closes-Bug: #1633063
Change-Id: I5526f791371e7a6f4cdad151bb163707504e76cf
(cherry picked from commit 939c026950756a926056a9ee24a18b02a150bb82)

commit_message:
Don't fail image create on failure of cleanup

The failure that caused us to run a cleanup delete is the thing we
actually care about reporting. If the cleanup has an error, shrug and
move on to reporting the creation error.

Change-Id: If3956188214b2f627b14e4d820cf27c3080fd4dd

commit_message:
Skip set of OVSDB connection manager target

Skip the ovs-vsctl set-manager call when starting an OVSDB
connection. This call isn't needed and the ovs-vsctl command won't
exist on the controller node when using the reference architecture.
As a result, any errors on the call will only mask the true OVSDB
connection error in the logs.

Change-Id: Ia21e50f8cad79348046fcd9ecdb13bced84016ee
Partial-Bug: #1612435

revisions:

To improve troubleshooting and readability, let's not have the puppet
logs print to the console.  This change updates the puppet apply to
output the logs to puppet.log which will still be captured and provided
in the CI results.  When the puppet apply fails, we will grep for
warnings and errors from the puppet log and only print those out which
should simplify troubleshooting failures.

Change-Id: I1084223f805f1960aebb9c5868fdef84ff3667e4
(cherry picked from commit e4c6f48efa90bab940d30118be25e4849c4aea5e)
"}]
commit_message:
Split out puppet logs

To improve troubleshooting and readability, let's not have the puppet
logs print to the console.  This change updates the puppet apply to
output the logs to puppet.log which will still be captured and provided
in the CI results.  When the puppet apply fails, we will grep for
warnings and errors from the puppet log and only print those out which
should simplify troubleshooting failures.

Change-Id: I1084223f805f1960aebb9c5868fdef84ff3667e4
(cherry picked from commit e4c6f48efa90bab940d30118be25e4849c4aea5e)

subject: Remove "dhcp" command from the iPXE script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 11:14:52.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/ipxe-dhcp-f82e17c956a5b887.yaml', 'templates/inspector_ipxe.erb'], 'message': 'Remove "dhcp" command from the iPXE script

At this point we already have DHCP on the right NIC to be able to download
this iPXE script. The "dhcp" may actually break the boot, as it runs DHCP
on the first available interface, not the PXE booting one.

Change-Id: I9ec62b6b662c9ea70f7cc12bd0567b5e4119faf7
Closes-Bug: #1635191
(cherry picked from commit 806d5a15693f7a0ce0cd379e7af81275bf334982)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "dhcp" command from the iPXE script

At this point we already have DHCP on the right NIC to be able to download
this iPXE script. The "dhcp" may actually break the boot, as it runs DHCP
on the first available interface, not the PXE booting one.

Change-Id: I9ec62b6b662c9ea70f7cc12bd0567b5e4119faf7

subject: Fix config drive writing script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 11:16:17.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/shell/copy_configdrive_to_disk.sh'], 'message': 'Fix config drive writing script

When the deployment happens on a GPT disk with config drive, writing
it to disk fails. Three reasons for that:

* parted should be used instead of partprobe to determine the type of
  the disk;
* gdisk -l sorts the partitions by their number, sort them by start
  sector instead;
* after sgdisk completion, the configdrive device is not immediately
  visible in the /dev folder, udevadm settle needed here too.

Closes-Bug: #1633063
Change-Id: Ifed89e343f9db4cf303baf7f8823342f6041f202
(cherry picked from commit 7bda3408f5bef4349c4e3537f3c8c0826a5dead8)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix config drive writing script

When the deployment happens on a GPT disk with config drive, writing
it to disk fails. Three reasons for that:

* parted should be used instead of partprobe to determine the type of
  the disk;
* gdisk -l sorts the partitions by their number, sort them by start
  sector instead;
* after sgdisk completion, the configdrive device is not immediately
  visible in the /dev folder, udevadm settle needed here too.

Closes-Bug: #1633063
Change-Id: Ifed89e343f9db4cf303baf7f8823342f6041f202
(cherry picked from commit 7bda3408f5bef4349c4e3537f3c8c0826a5dead8)

commit_message:
kuryr bind port error with neutron linux bridge driver

When neutron configured with linux bridge driver, kuryr will bind
port error. The linux bridge name should be "brq"+network_id[0,11].

Change-Id: I07be68bbfe7b1384f4e946664aed41546ff9ddce
Closes-bug: #1638041

To improve troubleshooting and readability, let's not have the puppet
logs print to the console.  This change updates the puppet apply to
output the logs to puppet.log which will still be captured and provided

commit_message:
Split out puppet logs

To improve troubleshooting and readability, let's not have the puppet
logs print to the console.  This change updates the puppet apply to
output the logs to puppet.log which will still be captured and provided
in the CI results.  When the puppet apply fails, we will grep for
warnings and errors from the puppet log and only print those out which
should simplify troubleshooting failures.

Change-Id: I1084223f805f1960aebb9c5868fdef84ff3667e4

subject: list_servers(): thread safety: never return bogus data.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-02 09:29:33.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'list_servers(): thread safety: never return bogus data.

Shade has a caching mechanism which is good. It's okay to return stale
data, that is, to return an "old view" of the resources. It's not okay
to return an "impossible" set of data, a bogus view of the data.

If two threads call list_severs() at the same time, the first will
acquire a lock, and start the query to Nova. The second
will try to acquire, lock is held, so it will return the cached server
list, which initially is '[]'. But there could be some servers, we
just don't know at that point.

In that case, we should block to acquire the lock, instead of return
an invalid view of the list of servers.

How to repro (Python3)
1) Create a couple of Nova servers
2) Run
import os_client_config, shade, concurrent.futures

cloud = os_client_config.make_shade(cloud='devstack')
with concurrent.futures.ThreadPoolExecutor(4) as exec:
    for i in range(3):
        exec.submit(lambda: print(len(cloud.list_servers())))

Change-Id: I32783d291c5d3d13b2fe86cd876931e25f8c4879
'}]
commit_message:
list_servers(): thread safety: never return bogus data.

Shade has a caching mechanism which is good. It's okay to return stale
data, that is, to return an "old view" of the resources. It's not okay
to return an "impossible" set of data, a bogus view of the data.

If two threads call list_severs() at the same time, the first will
acquire a lock, and start the query to Nova. The second
will try to acquire, lock is held, so it will return the cached server
list, which initially is '[]'. But there could be some servers, we
just don't know at that point.

In that case, we should block to acquire the lock, instead of return
an invalid view of the list of servers.

How to repro (Python3)
1) Create a couple of Nova servers
2) Run
import os_client_config, shade, concurrent.futures

cloud = os_client_config.make_shade(cloud='devstack')
with concurrent.futures.ThreadPoolExecutor(4) as exec:
    for i in range(3):
        exec.submit(lambda: print(len(cloud.list_servers())))

Change-Id: I32783d291c5d3d13b2fe86cd876931e25f8c4879

commit_message:
api-ref: document the power_state enum values

The OS-EXT-STS:power_state attribute in a server GET response
is enum values which are meaningless unless you look at the
nova/compute/power_states.py code. This change adds a mapping
to the description on that field in the api-ref.

Note there are gaps in the sequence, those are for unused values
as seen in the nova.objects.fields.InstancePowerState class.

Change-Id: I2ef9f493e66ab04b13f439e73247dc306a1514b4

commit_message:
Clean up of OVS port on source host post migration

After live migration of an instance, as part of the cleanup,
the deletion of port from OVS is not happening on source host.

With this fix, the OVS port is cleaned up as part of the
post live migration on source.

Change-Id: I83ac822c39b4dcc023f71d7f3766ceefe52a8022
Closes-Bug: #1637551
(cherry picked from commit 7c968936006fa51a8a463482412346a8f71f17dd)

subject: NFS mounting for Glance file backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-01 12:34:32.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/glance/nfs_mount.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/glance/api.pp'], 'message': "NFS mounting for Glance file backend

Previously we did this with Pacemaker, but with move to NG HA
architecture we lost the ability to use NFS mounts as image storage for
Glance. This reimplements the mounting without utilizing Pacemaker. The
mount is by default also written to /etc/fstab so that it persists over
reboot, but this behavior can be disabled.

This could also go to puppet-glance eventually, but not yet -- we need
this backported to Newton because it's a TripleO regression. I don't
think puppet-glance would allow backporting this to Newton, because from
their point of view it would be a RFE rather than a regression.

Change-Id: I45ad34c36587a8d695069368cf791f1efb68256c
Related-Bug: #1635606
(cherry picked from commit ad4e331917a2da9f2fd8215369736896348244fd)
"}]
commit_message:
NFS mounting for Glance file backend

Previously we did this with Pacemaker, but with move to NG HA
architecture we lost the ability to use NFS mounts as image storage for
Glance. This reimplements the mounting without utilizing Pacemaker. The
mount is by default also written to /etc/fstab so that it persists over
reboot, but this behavior can be disabled.

This could also go to puppet-glance eventually, but not yet -- we need
this backported to Newton because it's a TripleO regression. I don't
think puppet-glance would allow backporting this to Newton, because from
their point of view it would be a RFE rather than a regression.

Change-Id: I45ad34c36587a8d695069368cf791f1efb68256c
Related-Bug: #1635606
(cherry picked from commit ad4e331917a2da9f2fd8215369736896348244fd)

commit_message:
Manila hooks support

This code moves all deps to an external class so that Manila can be
installed with mechanisms besides packages (like venv or docker). This
also cleans-up the dependency tree by removing false or confusing
dependencies.

Change-Id: I053dbef10d51664d99e633abb714b3520a681e96

commit_message:
Eliminate use of a now obsolete admin basePath variable

The ironic plugin was using a basePath variable provided by the dashboard.admin
module. This variable appears to have been recently removed from the admin
module, and actually should not have been used by ironic in the first place.
The dashboard.ironic module now privides its own basePath variable.

Change-Id: I3df31c5f46e99e3b4f5b45daf7f1aa11fa623b1c

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-17 21:28:23.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/shell/copy_configdrive_to_disk.sh'], 'message': 'Fix config drive writing script

When the deployment happens on a GPT disk with config drive, writing
it to disk fails. Three reasons for that:

* parted should be used instead of partprobe to determine the type of
  the disk;
* gdisk -l sorts the partitions by their number, sort them by start
  sector instead;
* after sgdisk completion, the configdrive device is not immediately
  visible in the /dev folder, udevadm settle needed here too.

Closes-Bug: #1633063
Change-Id: Ifed89e343f9db4cf303baf7f8823342f6041f202
'}]
commit_message:
Fix config drive writing script

When the deployment happens on a GPT disk with config drive, writing
it to disk fails. Three reasons for that:

* parted should be used instead of partprobe to determine the type of
  the disk;
* gdisk -l sorts the partitions by their number, sort them by start
  sector instead;
* after sgdisk completion, the configdrive device is not immediately
  visible in the /dev folder, udevadm settle needed here too.

Closes-Bug: #1633063
Change-Id: Ifed89e343f9db4cf303baf7f8823342f6041f202

subject: Remove "dhcp" command from the iPXE script
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-20 16:06:16.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/ipxe-dhcp-f82e17c956a5b887.yaml', 'templates/inspector_ipxe.erb'], 'message': 'Remove "dhcp" command from the iPXE script

At this point we already have DHCP on the right NIC to be able to download
this iPXE script. The "dhcp" may actually break the boot, as it runs DHCP
on the first available interface, not the PXE booting one.

Change-Id: I9ec62b6b662c9ea70f7cc12bd0567b5e4119faf7
Closes-Bug: #1635191
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "dhcp" command from the iPXE script

At this point we already have DHCP on the right NIC to be able to download
this iPXE script. The "dhcp" may actually break the boot, as it runs DHCP
on the first available interface, not the PXE booting one.

Change-Id: I9ec62b6b662c9ea70f7cc12bd0567b5e4119faf7
Closes-Bug: #1635191

commit_message:
Make method import_versioned_module work

We hard-code module name in method import_versioned_module,
but downstream projects can't work and must provide specific
version of this method[1], and we don't use it in any project,
so we don't need consider backwards compatible issue.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=import_versioned_module&i=nope&files=&repos=

Closes-Bug: #1627313
Change-Id: I9eac6e63283a6b3a364307b32c567d27e97bdb6e

commit_message:
Add a missing error check in ipmitool driver's reboot

This patch adds a missing error check into ipmitool power driver's
reboot so that the reboot can fail properly if power off failed.

Change-Id: Icd061fe51555be3200b154c5e43e0f082864c93f
Closes-bug: #1633992

commit_message:
Remove "dhcp" command from the iPXE template

At this point we already have DHCP on the right NIC to be able to download
this iPXE script. The "dhcp" may actually break the boot, as it runs DHCP
on the first available interface, not the PXE booting one.

Change-Id: I97dc897da49ceb8e03476ddacd5bc92dd40aa4b2
Closes-Bug: #1635191

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-28 10:05:47.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/context.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/utils/test_keystone_utils.py', 'mistral/utils/openstack/keystone.py'], 'message': "Use service catalog from authentication response

When using Mistral in multi openstack deployments, user can pass
'X-Target-Auth-Uri' in the header to let Mistral run openstack service
actions in different openstack deployment. 'X-Target-Service-Catalog'
can also be provided but it's optional.

This patch adds 'is_target' attribute to Mistral context, if it's true,
Mistral will talk to another openstack deployment, 'service_catalog'
in the context can be empty or contain target service catalog provided
by user, Mistral will get service catalog dynamically if it's empty;
if it's false, the 'service_catalog' in context can also be empty(when
auth_enable=False) or the content that get from keystone authentication
response.

This patch also fix the tempest failure introduced by:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/387883/

Related-Bug: #1634090
Change-Id: Iec3ed0333cd08831f0a15f77e3880f07dd89e1e8
"}]
commit_message:
Use service catalog from authentication response

When using Mistral in multi openstack deployments, user can pass
'X-Target-Auth-Uri' in the header to let Mistral run openstack service
actions in different openstack deployment. 'X-Target-Service-Catalog'
can also be provided but it's optional.

This patch adds 'is_target' attribute to Mistral context, if it's true,
Mistral will talk to another openstack deployment, 'service_catalog'
in the context can be empty or contain target service catalog provided
by user, Mistral will get service catalog dynamically if it's empty;
if it's false, the 'service_catalog' in context can also be empty(when
auth_enable=False) or the content that get from keystone authentication
response.

This patch also fix the tempest failure introduced by:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/387883/

Related-Bug: #1634090
Change-Id: Iec3ed0333cd08831f0a15f77e3880f07dd89e1e8

commit_message:
Log currently known iSCSI devices when we retry waiting for iSCSI target

Otherwise it's very hard to investigate what went wrong.

As it accesses the hard drive, only do it if logging.DEBUG is enabled.

Change-Id: I55665d8453d50c4d240bbc5ef8d83f3316836a52

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-09 21:16:45.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/neutron-base.yaml'], 'message': 'Adjust MTU to compensate for VLAN tag issue

Some network configurations uncovered what appears to be an issue where
a spurious 802.1q header is injected into tunnelled traffic. Adjusting
the default value to accomodate the extra overhead should avoid this
problem.

Partial-Bug: #1621533
Change-Id: I9ebad2d6ad34d90fcb998497873059995cdef276
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust MTU to compensate for VLAN tag issue

Some network configurations uncovered what appears to be an issue where
a spurious 802.1q header is injected into tunnelled traffic. Adjusting
the default value to accomodate the extra overhead should avoid this
problem.

Partial-Bug: #1621533
Change-Id: I9ebad2d6ad34d90fcb998497873059995cdef276

commit_message:
list_security_groups: enable server-side filtering

For instance, this allows to:
  * With Nova, list all security-groups, for all tenants
  * With Neutron, filter security-groups to a specific project.

And much more (basically all filtering that Nova or Neutron allows).

(Also, this review removes 2 useless setUp methods. Not related
to this commit, but it's trivial and let's save some white bears)

Change-Id: I3cc5de57d780c73faf252cdcb842e5cff08fee9b

subject: Disable hatool before the upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-28 14:14:11.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/upgrade-utilities/playbooks/disable_hatool.yml', 'scripts/run-upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Disable hatool before the upgrade

If the router ha tool reports a failure to reach the neutron agent,
the router will be migrated to another agent, and then its hostname
will not be properly migrated because two dhcp owned ports for the
same network (sbunet with dhcp enabled) will be present. The first
one will be migrated to new hostname, while the other one will be
remaining there and never migrated. Running the playbook another
time will cause issues.

This should avoid automatic move of dhcp ports, and therefore
every port should be in its correct state before its upgrade.

The hatool will then be enabled if needed during the neutron role.

Change-Id: I63ba10c4b3333f4014679efea5389b163b5b953e
'}]
commit_message:
Disable hatool before the upgrade

If the router ha tool reports a failure to reach the neutron agent,
the router will be migrated to another agent, and then its hostname
will not be properly migrated because two dhcp owned ports for the
same network (sbunet with dhcp enabled) will be present. The first
one will be migrated to new hostname, while the other one will be
remaining there and never migrated. Running the playbook another
time will cause issues.

This should avoid automatic move of dhcp ports, and therefore
every port should be in its correct state before its upgrade.

The hatool will then be enabled if needed during the neutron role.

Change-Id: I63ba10c4b3333f4014679efea5389b163b5b953e

subject: Stop all but one RabbitMQ node prior to upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-01 20:43:11.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml'], 'message': "Stop all but one RabbitMQ node prior to upgrade

RabbitMQ nodes must all be stopped prior to a major/minor version
upgrade [1]. The role does this by distinguishing between the upgrader
node and the rest in separate stop and start tasks.

Upgrades can fail when more than one member of rabbitmq_all are not
members of the cluster. This is due to a bug fixed for greenfield
deployments by 21c24789019bf1ee85347356fe6c70b0b9045d7c. The same fix
was not applied to upgrades because major/minor upgrades require all
RabbitMQ nodes to be stopped which is incompatible with serialising the
role in isolation.

This change uses a play to stop all but one of the nodes, prior to
running the rabbitmq_server role, and then serialises the running of
the role so that one node is upgraded at a time. This minimises the
downtime as much as possible while allowing the role to be applied to
one node at a time.

This change is related to an equivalent one [2] made to the test
playbook of the role openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server.

[1] http://www.rabbitmq.com/clustering.html#upgrading
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390966/

Conflicts:
    playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml

Backport note:
    The rabbitmq_all[1:] reference in the original review was changed
    to rabbitmq_all:!rabbitmq_all[0] as ansible 1.9 doesn't seem to
    handle the subscript correctly.

Change-Id: Icca5cb1a96f83063223b6ddbeb02eeb562b0931b
(cherry picked from commit 76639d6a8625c70152515e608b54d183cdfe383b)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop all but one RabbitMQ node prior to upgrade

RabbitMQ nodes must all be stopped prior to a major/minor version
upgrade [1]. The role does this by distinguishing between the upgrader
node and the rest in separate stop and start tasks.

Upgrades can fail when more than one member of rabbitmq_all are not
members of the cluster. This is due to a bug fixed for greenfield
deployments by 21c24789019bf1ee85347356fe6c70b0b9045d7c. The same fix
was not applied to upgrades because major/minor upgrades require all
RabbitMQ nodes to be stopped which is incompatible with serialising the
role in isolation.

This change uses a play to stop all but one of the nodes, prior to
running the rabbitmq_server role, and then serialises the running of
the role so that one node is upgraded at a time. This minimises the
downtime as much as possible while allowing the role to be applied to
one node at a time.

This change is related to an equivalent one [2] made to the test
playbook of the role openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server.

[1] http://www.rabbitmq.com/clustering.html#upgrading
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390966/

Conflicts:
    playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml

Backport note:
    The rabbitmq_all[1:] reference in the original review was changed
    to rabbitmq_all:!rabbitmq_all[0] as ansible 1.9 doesn't seem to
    handle the subscript correctly.

Change-Id: Icca5cb1a96f83063223b6ddbeb02eeb562b0931b
(cherry picked from commit 76639d6a8625c70152515e608b54d183cdfe383b)

commit_message:
Stop all but one RabbitMQ node prior to upgrade

RabbitMQ nodes must all be stopped prior to a major/minor version
upgrade [1]. The role does this by distinguishing between the upgrader
node and the rest in separate stop and start tasks.

Upgrades can fail when more than one member of rabbitmq_all are not
members of the cluster. This is due to a bug fixed for greenfield
deployments by 21c24789019bf1ee85347356fe6c70b0b9045d7c. The same fix
was not applied to upgrades because major/minor upgrades require all
RabbitMQ nodes to be stopped which is incompatible with serialising the
role in isolation.

This change uses a play to stop all but one of the nodes, prior to
running the rabbitmq_server role, and then serialises the running of
the role so that one node is upgraded at a time. This minimises the
downtime as much as possible while allowing the role to be applied to
one node at a time.

This change is related to an equivalent one [2] made to the test
playbook of the role openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server.

[1] http://www.rabbitmq.com/clustering.html#upgrading
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390966/

Change-Id: Icca5cb1a96f83063223b6ddbeb02eeb562b0931b
(cherry picked from commit 76639d6a8625c70152515e608b54d183cdfe383b)

subject: Re-add NFS backend for Glance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-01 12:31:00.000000000', 'files': ['environments/storage-environment.yaml', 'puppet/services/glance-base.yaml'], 'message': 'Re-add NFS backend for Glance

We lost ability to store Glance images in NFS mounts as we moved to NG
HA architecture. This patch re-adds that ability, but the parameter
interface changes because the semantics change as well. (Pacemaker
allowed for different mounts than just NFS so the parameters were more
generic, although we only ever tested and documented NFS usage.)

Change-Id: Ic5197e09846bbf75d780dcc74da1717dcf8301d0
Related-Bug: #1635606
(cherry picked from commit b6a4bdc3e4db97785b930065260c713f6e70a4da)
'}]
commit_message:
Re-add NFS backend for Glance

We lost ability to store Glance images in NFS mounts as we moved to NG
HA architecture. This patch re-adds that ability, but the parameter
interface changes because the semantics change as well. (Pacemaker
allowed for different mounts than just NFS so the parameters were more
generic, although we only ever tested and documented NFS usage.)

Change-Id: Ic5197e09846bbf75d780dcc74da1717dcf8301d0
Related-Bug: #1635606
(cherry picked from commit b6a4bdc3e4db97785b930065260c713f6e70a4da)

commit_message:
Use public endpoint as service reference URL

To avoid errors with API calls from clients to barbican, update the
host_href setting within barbican.conf to the publicURL of the barbican
service instead of localhost.

A notify has also been added to restart barbican services when
configuration files are changed.

Change-Id: I7460ad294d9b645170f9cce52d2e846ab04b46fa

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-02 09:42:43.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/lib/wbatch/batch_for_windows.sh'], 'message': 'Use type separate as work-around for VirtualBox 5.1.6

With VirtualBox 5.1.6, console type "headless" often gives no access to
the VM console which on Windows is the main method for interacting with

(cherry picked from commit 7310b0bc9ea7a872a2a73f9c0fb5a8b3534b9a3c)

commit_message:
Use type separate as work-around for VirtualBox 5.1.6

With VirtualBox 5.1.6, console type "headless" often gives no access to
the VM console which on Windows is the main method for interacting with
the cluster. Use "separate" for Windows batch files, which works at
least on 5.0.26 and 5.1.6.

Change-Id: Ib907ef2ac947547b7cce762a8426c92bb62f1abb
(cherry picked from commit 7310b0bc9ea7a872a2a73f9c0fb5a8b3534b9a3c)

subject: Stop all but one RabbitMQ node prior to upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-01 16:02:08.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-install-rabbitmq-server.yml'], 'message': 'Stop all but one RabbitMQ node prior to upgrade

RabbitMQ nodes must all be stopped prior to a major/minor version
upgrade [1]. The role does this by distinguishing between the upgrader
node and the rest in separate stop and start tasks.

Upgrades can fail when more than one member of rabbitmq_all are not
members of the cluster. This is due to a bug fixed for greenfield
deployments by 5dc67955f0ac08a7c9719d641e9828558620da89. The same fix
was not applied to upgrades because major/minor upgrades require all
RabbitMQ nodes to be stopped which is incompatible with serialising the
role in isolation.

This change uses a play to stop all but one of the nodes, prior to
running the rabbitmq_server role, and then serialises the running of
the role so that one node is upgraded at a time. This minimises the
downtime as much as possible while allowing the role to be applied to
one node at a time.

[1] http://www.rabbitmq.com/clustering.html#upgrading

Conflicts:
    tests/test-install-rabbitmq-server.yml

Change-Id: Icca5cb1a96f83063223b6ddbeb02eeb562b0931b
(cherry picked from commit 351dac725de3afd442455fadc755620a90522fca)
'}]
commit_message:
Stop all but one RabbitMQ node prior to upgrade

RabbitMQ nodes must all be stopped prior to a major/minor version
upgrade [1]. The role does this by distinguishing between the upgrader
node and the rest in separate stop and start tasks.

Upgrades can fail when more than one member of rabbitmq_all are not
members of the cluster. This is due to a bug fixed for greenfield
deployments by 5dc67955f0ac08a7c9719d641e9828558620da89. The same fix
was not applied to upgrades because major/minor upgrades require all
RabbitMQ nodes to be stopped which is incompatible with serialising the
role in isolation.

This change uses a play to stop all but one of the nodes, prior to
running the rabbitmq_server role, and then serialises the running of
the role so that one node is upgraded at a time. This minimises the
downtime as much as possible while allowing the role to be applied to
one node at a time.

[1] http://www.rabbitmq.com/clustering.html#upgrading

Conflicts:
    tests/test-install-rabbitmq-server.yml

Change-Id: Icca5cb1a96f83063223b6ddbeb02eeb562b0931b
(cherry picked from commit 351dac725de3afd442455fadc755620a90522fca)

commit_message:
Stop our changes to /etc/sudoers from tripping up apt-get

The Mitaka and Liberty scripts currently fail because preseed's changes
to /etc/sudoers result in a problem (i.e., a prompt) when apt-get tries
to install an update for the sudo package.

This bug has been fixed in Newton but needed backporting to Liberty
and Mitaka.

Change-Id: I6ca06d1845412cc2eb451b67d9c74f4772950a7f
(cherry picked from commit 9d3d5c5b62ddc4013c504be6658f13e1a64f784d)

commit_message:
Stop our changes to /etc/sudoers from tripping up apt-get

The Mitaka and Liberty scripts currently fail because preseed's changes
to /etc/sudoers result in a problem (i.e., a prompt) when apt-get tries
to install an update for the sudo package.

This bug has been fixed in Newton but needed backporting to Liberty
and Mitaka.

Change-Id: I6ca06d1845412cc2eb451b67d9c74f4772950a7f

subject: Decrease keystone_user count number in check_oswl_stat
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-26 16:36:59.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/helpers/checkers.py'], 'message': "Decrease keystone_user count number in check_oswl_stat

Commit Iead5167210c4132badb866afc25d4ef14e27f6b2 introduces change
according which Swift resourses shouldn't been created if Ceph is
enabled. Swift user in Keystone database also shouldn't been created
in this case. That's why decreasing of keystone_user count is needed
in check_oswl_stat method.

Change-Id: I00ab09191ce6919d74a16a76249719f8cfb01800
Closes-Bug: #1634810
"}]
commit_message:
Decrease keystone_user count number in check_oswl_stat

Commit Iead5167210c4132badb866afc25d4ef14e27f6b2 introduces change
according which Swift resourses shouldn't been created if Ceph is
enabled. Swift user in Keystone database also shouldn't been created
in this case. That's why decreasing of keystone_user count is needed
in check_oswl_stat method.

Change-Id: I00ab09191ce6919d74a16a76249719f8cfb01800
Closes-Bug: #1634810

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-27 08:06:06.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'message': "Add 'Container' field for MD parser

The logic of filtering of fake RAID MD heavily relies on the
presence of of 'Container' field inside of parsed data.
If this field is missing, it will never figure out the name of any
fake RAID devices and its component.

This patch adds this field to a parser.

In addition to that, it also logs all found fake RAIDs and
their components for the sake of easy debugging.

Change-Id: I2066c5a0e995e542271cd308c9d83e2373787be4
Closes-Bug: #1617071
(cherry picked from commit 60173537665464db260fb93829eb8affced33535)
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'Container' field for MD parser

The logic of filtering of fake RAID MD heavily relies on the
presence of of 'Container' field inside of parsed data.
If this field is missing, it will never figure out the name of any
fake RAID devices and its component.

This patch adds this field to a parser.

In addition to that, it also logs all found fake RAIDs and
their components for the sake of easy debugging.

Change-Id: I2066c5a0e995e542271cd308c9d83e2373787be4
Closes-Bug: #1617071
(cherry picked from commit 60173537665464db260fb93829eb8affced33535)

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-02 03:48:36.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/api/openstack_v1/test_stacks.py', 'heat/api/openstack/v1/stacks.py'], 'message': "Ignore merged env if environment files are specified

Ignore merged environment from the client, if there are
'environment_files' in the request for merging in the server.
This would avoid the duplicates when 'parameter_merge_strategies'

Change-Id: I4ee274d69e42a47c4b8fd5a25567fb2eb144a8cc
Related-Bug: #1635409
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore merged env if environment files are specified

Ignore merged environment from the client, if there are
'environment_files' in the request for merging in the server.
This would avoid the duplicates when 'parameter_merge_strategies'
are specified in the first env file.

Change-Id: I4ee274d69e42a47c4b8fd5a25567fb2eb144a8cc
Related-Bug: #1635409

subject: Don't depend on translated strings for error check
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7249, 'name': 'Ann Taraday', 'email': 'akamyshnikova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AKamyshnikova'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-01 12:39:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Don't depend on translated strings for error check

Currently, execute() may raise an exception that contains a *translated*
string that starts with 'Exit code: %(returncode)d...' if the returncode
of a process was not 0. find_child_pids() will then check if the
raised exception contains 'Exit code: 1' (to check if the returncode is
1), but in non-English locales this will fail as the 2 strings are not
encoded the same.

This patch adds a new ProcessExecutionError (which inherits from
RuntimeError, so as to not change all the code that currently depends on
execute() returning RuntimeError) which now accepts a returncode. This
can be changed explicitly without depending on the error message.

Later patches can move ProcessExecutionError to neutron-lib, if this is
needed - this patch intends to write the smallest piece of code that can
be backported.

Closes-Bug: #1638273
Change-Id: I85d3bec13e852918eb13e73c1367c70e1f4d34b1
"}]
commit_message:
Don't depend on translated strings for error check

Currently, execute() may raise an exception that contains a *translated*
string that starts with 'Exit code: %(returncode)d...' if the returncode
of a process was not 0. find_child_pids() will then check if the
raised exception contains 'Exit code: 1' (to check if the returncode is
1), but in non-English locales this will fail as the 2 strings are not
encoded the same.

This patch adds a new ProcessExecutionError (which inherits from
RuntimeError, so as to not change all the code that currently depends on
execute() returning RuntimeError) which now accepts a returncode. This
can be changed explicitly without depending on the error message.

Later patches can move ProcessExecutionError to neutron-lib, if this is
needed - this patch intends to write the smallest piece of code that can
be backported.

Closes-Bug: #1638273
Change-Id: I85d3bec13e852918eb13e73c1367c70e1f4d34b1

subject: Removing token revoke / delete calls
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-28 12:05:11.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/tests/tests.py', 'openstack_auth/views.py', 'openstack_auth/utils.py'], 'message': 'Removing token revoke / delete calls

Keysonte is changing the nature of tokens, timeouts, and long
running tasks.  In addition, horizon can also cause issues where
a user starts a long running tasks, logs out, and then the token
fails authenticaion.   Just removing this problematic logic.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/session-extendable-tokens

Closes-Bug: #1637460
Change-Id: I5eda08e95d8df72ba601181f02a72de37c5393fd
(cherry picked from commit 5810f9c6d92f8e1febbb25f5486778dbf416991c)
'}]
commit_message:
Removing token revoke / delete calls

Keysonte is changing the nature of tokens, timeouts, and long
running tasks.  In addition, horizon can also cause issues where
a user starts a long running tasks, logs out, and then the token
fails authenticaion.   Just removing this problematic logic.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/session-extendable-tokens

Closes-Bug: #1637460
Change-Id: I5eda08e95d8df72ba601181f02a72de37c5393fd
(cherry picked from commit 5810f9c6d92f8e1febbb25f5486778dbf416991c)

commit_message:
Don't pass argument sqlite_db in method set_defaults

Config option sqlite_db is deprecated for removal[1], and isn't used
in both oslo.db and ec2-api, so don't need set its default value.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/blob/0a1bae/oslo_db/options.py#L17

Change-Id: I36d643edd29f5db4907ef842b22d33625a6804d3

commit_message:
Adapt magnum client for async bay creation

Magnum have changed the behavior of bay creation from synchronous
to async so this patch change the output of command bay-create to
show only uuid instead of bay._info['list'] to adapt with new async
behaviour.

Change-Id: I4941eeac087d7a4dc9afaf2c07e3671fdba2d289
Closes-Bug: #1613556

Nova is working on slowly unwinding it's dependence on

run the grenade multinode job with neutron rather than
nova-network. Nova still has grenade coverage for nova-network
for nova with the gate-grenade-dsvm-ubuntu-xenial job
that is a full upgrade.

Change-Id: Idf5e165b8df9bdb88b4fdafe76cc548e483ff891
"}]
commit_message:
Switch nova to run neutron grenade multinode jobs

Nova is working on slowly unwinding it's dependence on
nova-network in the CI system. This change makes nova
run the grenade multinode job with neutron rather than
nova-network. Nova still has grenade coverage for nova-network
for nova with the gate-grenade-dsvm-ubuntu-xenial job
that is a full upgrade.

Change-Id: Idf5e165b8df9bdb88b4fdafe76cc548e483ff891

subject: Fix fernet related components added to fact var properly.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-01 15:14:39.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/keystone/tasks/do_reconfigure.yml'], 'message': 'Fix fernet related components added to fact var properly.

Previous version of keystone reconfigure fails at adding fernet
components to fact variable "keystone_item".
Ansible can not create fact variable using newly created variable
in a same task.

This patch set split this task into two tasks, first create variable
containing fernet components, then merge it to "keystone_item".

Change-Id: I15571ab20d6104d30350e8b922401b462336fca0
Closes-Bug: #1636047
(cherry picked from commit 8c8e296ecf7d6259cd29a5aaefb8d03ba5d8c05a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fernet related components added to fact var properly.

Previous version of keystone reconfigure fails at adding fernet
components to fact variable "keystone_item".
Ansible can not create fact variable using newly created variable
in a same task.

This patch set split this task into two tasks, first create variable
containing fernet components, then merge it to "keystone_item".

Change-Id: I15571ab20d6104d30350e8b922401b462336fca0
Closes-Bug: #1636047
(cherry picked from commit 8c8e296ecf7d6259cd29a5aaefb8d03ba5d8c05a)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-27 14:13:45.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim
support for Python 3.5 in the classifier.
This patch also adds the convenience py35 venv.

Change-Id: Ieadaabcdf798f7544e7203105ebfcd4308a92823
'}]
commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim
support for Python 3.5 in the classifier.
This patch also adds the convenience py35 venv.

Change-Id: Ieadaabcdf798f7544e7203105ebfcd4308a92823
